title: What are some new trends for small businesses? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are a few I have noticed: PERFECT PARTNERSHIPS Creating additional value for customers by collaborating with like-minded companies to deliver expanded offerings (cross-channel rewards, additive experiences). Examples: @Gap + @VirginHotels – order from Gap, get delivered to hotel room in 3hrs, @Instacart + @AllRecipes 1-click ordering and delivery of ingredients. More to discover: How to Shop Online ...Online Shopping Research Results RECOGNIZE & PERSONALIZE Putting systems in place for remembering and acting on the purchase history and preferences of customers, and tailoring those experiences over time (360-degree service, predictive assistance). Examples: @Walgreens pharmacy app anticipates needs (e.g. Rx refills), @modaoperandi in-store CRM for high-touch store service PROMOTE TRANSPARENCY Being upfront with consumers about the policies and processes that underlie the products and services that they’re buying into (reciprocal relationships, stored products). Examples: @Waitrose loyalty scheme allows members to pick their deals. @Amazon Elements product line allows customers to track items from creation to expiration. Mike Schoultz is the founder of Digital Spark Marketing, a digital marketing and customer service agency. With 40 years of business experience, he consults on and writes about topics to help improve the performance of small business. Find him on G+, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Small businesses are adopting social media each day. The reason is that it seems to be where consumers are spending their time. Facebook has 2 billion monthly active users.Instagram has 800 million monthly active users.Additionally, social media allows small businesses to target potential customers with ads. In fact, the choose-your-own-budget approach by many social media platforms is a good opportunity for businesses to sell a product, boost videos, generate leads, and more, at a cost that they can afford. I hope this helps!
